page.title: 14Dairy Farming
page.content: I live near a dairy farm. The cows belong to Farmer Chipperfield. The farmer sells his milk to the Milk Marketing Board. The field is behind our house. Sometimes the cows are put on another field that is behind the one near us. The cows are on the field at the moment. The farmer moves them so that the grass can regrow. There is a barbed wire fence all around the field so people can't get in but we can take our dog for a walk on the field when the cows aren't in it. At about 8.30 in the morning the cows are fed. Two weeks ago (early June) they came and cut the grass and threw stones onto our garden. The farmer also has one field of wheat. When this is cut they have to shoot all the rabbits. Rachael Burley
